revised_title: Comparative Anatomy of Flowers: Floral Units and Vascular Cords
tldr: The authors study the floral units and vascular cords in flowers, explaining their origins and how they give rise to various floral appendages. They discuss the significance of the relative positions of these elements and the importance of understanding their development for interpreting the "receptacular tube" and the "inferior ovary." The authors also explore the effects of processes like union, separation, and fusion of cords on the formation of floral parts and the phenomena of cohesion and adhesion.
